name: Notorious Oscar Wilde Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Wilde was not the first member of his immediate family to become immersed in scandals and trials. Who was?
questions.explanation:
His father.

	His father, a prominent surgeon, was charged with criminal misconduct involving a woman patient. There was a sensational trial.

questions.text: A relationship with this poet was a key part of Wilde's downfall.
questions.explanation:
Alfred Douglas.

	Lord Alfred Douglas, also known as "Bosie", was a poet of the day who has since faded into obscurity. The relationship of the two led to trouble for Wilde when Alfred's father, the Marquis of Queensbury, accused Wilde of "posing as a somdomite" (sic). This comment precipitated the trials that led to Wilde's downfall. (De Musset, a poet, had a famous relationship with George Sand; Rimbaud, a poet  had a famous relationship with fellow poet Paul Verlaine.)

questions.text: Which is true of Oscar Wilde?
options: He married, but had no children
He never married, but had relationships with women
questions.explanation:
He married and had children.

	He had a wife and two children.

questions.text: "De Profundis" was written by Wilde as a memoir. Where did he write it?
questions.explanation:
In prison.

	Thoughts and reflections about Lord Alfred, written while Wilde was doing time in prison.

questions.text:
"The Importance of Being Earnest" is considered Wilde's masterpiece.
Who is NOT a character in the play?
questions.explanation:
Salome.

	Clever stuff. "Salome" is another play by Wilde.

questions.text: Which line comes from "The Ballad of Reading Gaol"?
questions.correct: Each man kills the thing he loves
options: I have been faithful to thee, Cynara
Stone walls do not a prison make
I am the master of my fate
questions.explanation:
Each man kills the thing he loves.

	More from prison. "Cynara" is by Dowson, "Fate" is by Henley and "Walls" is by Lovelace.

questions.text: "The Picture of Dorian Gray" is another masterpiece by Wilde. In the novel, who paints the famous picture?
questions.explanation:
Basil.

	Good movie version with Hurd Hatfield, Donna Reed, Angela Lansbury and Peter Lawford.

questions.text: Which play is NOT by Wilde?
questions.explanation:
The Way of the World.

	Wilde mostly wrote light plays that sparkled because of his use of language and his clever epigrams.

questions.text: "Gross Indecency: The Three Trials of Oscar Wilde" was a recent play about Wilde's misadventures in court. Who wrote the play?
questions.explanation:
Moises Kauffman.

	Edson wrote "Wit". Auburn wrote "Proof". Kushner wrote "Angels in America".

questions.text: Which is true of Wilde's last days?
options: He enjoyed renewed success in society
questions.explanation:
He died penniless.

	It is said that as he lay dying in a seedy hotel room he looked around and said: 'it's me or the wallpaper - one of us has got to go".
